sub_title: Rotating Equipment Manager & Process Manager (U&O), Rotterdam Capacity Growth Project Owner’s Team at Neste
summary:
I currently work as an Expat in Rotterdam, where I am a member of a multi-cultural team. Here I hold the responsibility for both Rotating Equipment and Process design for Utilities & Offsites for our Rotterdam Expansion project.

My work has mostly had a focus on petrochemicals and oil industry with some software and IT matters on the side. I have covered a wide range from energy efficiency projects to brownfield industrial sites with various considerations in both process functionality and safety fields. 

My passion is to always strive to challenge myself in whatever I do and strive to keep learning and developing my skills to tackle new targets and goals.

education.grade: GPA of 3.6/5 and M.Sc thesis with a grade of 4/5

projects.title: Rotterdam Expansion
projects.description: Neste’s current 1.4 million ton capacity for renewable products in Rotterdam is the largest in Europe. The Rotterdam refinery expansion investment of approximately EUR 1.9 billion will expand Neste’s overall renewable product capacity by 1.3 million tons per annum, bringing the total renewable product capacity in Rotterdam to 2.7 million tons annually, of which sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) production capability will be 1.2 million tons. The company’s target is to start up the new production unit during the first half of 2026.

projects.description: I functioned as a knowledge support for the new organizers of the event, a 1600 passenger cruise from Helsinki to Stockholm. I helped the Organizing Committee in challenges they met and conveyed the knowledge I have gained through my various years of organizing the event.

contributors.headline: Rotating Equipment Manager & Process Manager (U&O), Rotterdam Capacity Growth Project Owner’s Team at Neste

projects.title: Pirates of the Baltic Sea - Spring 2017 & Fall 2017
projects.description:
As a consultant for the National Events Committee, I helped and advised the team producing and developing the next editions of a 1600 passenger cruise from Helsinki to Stockholm. The Committee consisted of 7 people working on one of the biggest ESN events entire Europe wide association. 

My role as a Consultant was to guide and help the new Head of Organizing Committee in challenges he meets and to help facilitate the connection between the Erasmus Student Network Finland and Tallink Silja. Among other things I helped with: 
- Business & partnership model development
- Budgeting and Project management
- Meetings with partners and cruise company
- Managing activities on board the boat and representation towards external stakeholders. 
Main partners for the cruise include Aikamatkat Oy - Timetravels Ltd, Jnuine as well as Tallink Silja OY

projects.title: Pirates of the Baltic Sea - Fall 2016
projects.description:
As the main chair of the committee, I was in charge of the team producing and developing the next two editions of a 1600 passenger cruise from Helsinki to Stockholm. We had a team of 7 people working on one of the biggest editions of the event. 

My assignment as the Head of Organizing Committee was to function as the team leader for the team and those tasks included: 
- Management of the National Events Committee consisting of 7 members
- Business & partnership model development
- Budgeting and Project management
- Meetings with partners and cruise company
- Managing activities on board the boat and representation towards external stakeholders. 
Main partners for the cruise include Aikamatkat Oy - Timetravels Ltd, Jnuine as well as Tallink Silja OY

projects.title: Pirates of the Baltic Sea - Fall 2015 & Spring 2016
projects.description:
During my time as the Vice-President of the Erasmus Student Network Finland, I led a team in charge of the production and development of two 1400 passenger cruises from Helsinki to Stockholm. We worked on renewing the visual identity of the cruise and rebranding it, development of additional program concepts as well as the acquisition of new partners. 

My assignment as the Head of Organizing Committee was to function as the team leader for the team and those tasks included: 
- Management of the event organizing team consisting of 4-5 members
- Development of the business model for the cruise
- Budgeting & Project management
- Meetings with partners and cruise company
- Managing activities on board the boat and representation towards external stakeholders. 
Main partners for the cruise include Aikamatkat Oy - Timetravels Ltd, Jnuine and Hard Rock Cafe Helsinki as well as Tallink Silja OY

Fall 2015 - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HYKGsqc_KH4
Spring 2016 - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tjKVEutgbh8

projects.title: Pretreatment facility for Renewable raw materials
projects.description:
The course project was done for a client with a 6 member team. It included accurate process design including the different equipment used in the unit operations as well as the simulation of said units with Aspen Plus. The layout of the plant was done using Microsoft Visio. In addition financial estimations, hazop research and site survey were performed by our team.

I was mostly responsible for simulations with Aspen Plus, plant layout planning with Visio and equipment design.

profile_positions.description:
Rotating Equipment & Process Manager in our Rotterdam Capacity Growth project.

Management of Home Office resources and for both Rotating Equipment & Process Design departments. Responsible for coordination of vendor documentation for the Material Requisitions falling under Rotating Equipment.

From Process Design side responsible for Utilities and Offsites including Steam/Condensate, Cooling Water, Nitrogen, Natural gas, Air and Firewater networks.
profile_positions.title: Rotating Equipment Manager & Process Manager (U&O)

Rotating Equipment & Process Manager in our Rotterdam Capacity Growth project.

From Process Design side responsible for Utilities and Offsites including Steam/Condensate, Cooling Water, Nitrogen, Natural gas, Air and Firewater networks.
profile_positions.title: Rotating Equipment Manager & Process Manager (U&O)

profile_positions.description: Process Manager in our Rotterdam Capacity Growth project. Responsible for Utilities and Offsites including Steam/Condensate, Cooling Water, Nitrogen, Air and Firewater networks as well as the storage solutions and shipping solutions for the products and feedstocks.
profile_positions.title: Process Manager, Utilities & Offsites

profile_positions.description: As a Senior Process Design Engineer, I worked in projects related to energy efficiency, equipment renewal, new process equipment commissioning and new process concept design. I have been responsible for a wide range of tasks ranging from designing and sizing new equipment to defining new engineering systems.
profile_positions.title: Senior Process Design Engineer

profile_positions.description: I worked as the Technical Lead for Engineering Digitalisation, in which capacity I coordinated the implementation of a new cross-disciplinary database-based commercial software to replace and support various in-house tools for all engineering work.
profile_positions.title: Technical Lead for Engineering Digitalisation

profile_positions.description:
In the end of year 2017 Neste Jacobs was fully acquired by Neste and at that point, the company came to be known as Neste Engineering Solutions, operating fully under the Neste corporation brand. 

I am currently working as the Technical Lead for Engineering Digitalisation, in which capacity I coordinate the implementation of a new cross-disciplinary database-based software to replace various in-house tools for all engineering work. 

As a Process Design Engineer, I have worked in projects related to energy efficiency, equipment renewal and new process equipment commissioning. I have been responsible for a wide range of tasks ranging from drafting of new P&iD diagrams to designing and sizing new equipment. I have additionally modeled liquid networks with Pipenet and steam and condensate systems using Fortum Solvo.
profile_positions.title: Process Design Engineer

company.name: Aalto University School of Science and Technology

profile_positions.description:
My thesis is focused on biorefineries and the screening of a suitable solvent for the selective extraction of biorefinery products like furfural and acetic acid. Recent measurements include binary, ternary and quaternary liquid-liquid equilibria as well as binary vapor-liquid equilibria measurements between furfural, acetic acid, water and solvent solutions.

The goal of this project was to find an effective and selective solvent for the extraction of furfural from biorefinery product streams that also contain other components like acids or decomposition products of furfural.
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Candidate, Chemical Engineering

profile_positions.description: I worked in a project for vapor-liquid and liquid-liquid equilibrium measurements as an analyst / research assistant. I managed two different types of analysis equipment for liquid-liquid measurements, one of which I have also helped construct and take in to use. I have also worked with a glass cell type apparatus for vapor-liquid measurements. All results have been analyzed with a gas chromatograph.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Master’s thesis project with the goal of taking a new absorption kinetics measurement apparatus in use and validating it with measurements found in literature. In addition new measurement data was created for hydrogen sulfide and amine solutions for an academic peer review paper.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Course assistant in analytical chemistry laboratory. My responsibility was and to ensure that the students learn how to use different analysis methods to analyze samples. I guided them in their work and graded their reports.
profile_positions.title: Course Assistant

profile_positions.description:
My initial four months of employment in the Neste corporation were under the brand of Neste Jacobs, now known as Neste Engineering Solutions.

In my first months I worked on projects related to the design of new equipment and modelling of complex liquid networks. Additionally, I drafted P&iD diagrams and sized various process equipment.
profile_positions.title: Process Design Engineer

profile_positions.description: I held an evening class on mechanical processes related to Chemical Engineering. The class included topics like mixing, filtration, transportation, storage and other unit operations applicable in the daily work of a plant operator or process designer.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.title: Lecturer

volunteer_experiences.description:
2023 - Associate

2021/2022 - Board support for IT & Event Organization matters.

2020 - Vice President and project manager for FYP Cruise 2020. In 2020 I was responsible for the coordination and management of the volunteer team planning the organization of the 2020 edition of FYP Cruise. Despite the event being cancelled, work was laid out for the next board to take over. Additionally, I functioned as the Vice President for the association and was partially responsible for our IT management tasks. 

2019 - Board Member and project manager for FYP Cruise 2019. In 2019 I was responsible for the coordination and management of the volunteer team organizing the 2019 edition of FYP Cruise. Additionally, I assisted the board in organization of other events to support the networking of the 20+ companies in FYP.

2018 - Network Leader for Neste Young Refiners. I handled communication between the Finland Young Professionals (FYP) national network and Neste Young Refiners board. I took part in organizing the Summer Event for FYP as well as the yearly cruise event.

2019 - Vice President. As the vice president I coordinated with our president and helped her in all matters related to management of the team. Additionally, I assisted in any events and projects the board took on during 2019.

2018 - Network Leader for Neste Young Refiners. I handleed communication between the Finland Young Professionals (FYP) national network and Neste Young Refiners board. I took part in organizing the Summer Event for FYP as well as the yearly cruise event.

ESN Finland Alumni ry provides networking opportunities for the Alumni of Erasmus Student Network in Finland as well as aims to provide the network with support for finances as well as operate as an advisory body with extensive knowledge.

As the President, I was responsible for the overall management of the association. As part of it I chaired the board and association meetings, organize networking events, and help manage financial matters. 

At the beginning of the first mandate of the Alumni Board in 2018 spring, the association was registered into the Finnish Association Registry.

During my time in the association I have held various positions within the organization, such as:

The Main chair, founder and the manager of the National Events Committee of Erasmus Student Network Finland (2016). In this project I was joined by a chairing team of two vice-chairs and together we, and the 4 additional volunteers, produced an edition of the Pirates of the Baltic Sea cruise as well as assisted in other National Events in Finland. My tasks included management of the event budget and the team as well as oversight over the entire project. This included such things as branding and business development as well as representation duties towards various stakeholders.

The Vice President of the Association (2015/2016), during which I was responsible for partnership negotiations and contact with our national level partners. In addition, I helped the other board members with their tasks as well as communicated with the local sections of the network regarding partnership matters. I also took ownership of the national event Pirates of the Baltic Sea as the project manager for the board term 2015/2016. The event was produced with a team of five energetic volunteers.

The President of the Association (2014/2015), which meant I was responsible for the management of the board of the association. The tasks involved ensuring the functions of the association, co-operating with organisational partners and chairing the meetings of both the association and the board and preparing materials for the meetings. I also co-managed the national event, Pirates of the Baltic Sea, communicated with the student unions, as well as partners of the association in national level and other stakeholders around Finland.

As the president of the association I managed the board and represented the association towards external stakeholders. The work included chairing the board and association meetings, organising and managing various events, management of the financial matters with the treasurer and representation towards the student union of Aalto University. In the beginning of the year 2013 I also took care of the registration process for the association into the Finnish Association Registry.

In parallel to the ESN work I was also responsible for the communication between the international section of AYY and different stakeholders working in the international student community. This included organizing “super meetings” for all the international associations related to Aalto University as well as other large student events.
